javax.jaxtx.acid
Interface TwoPhaseParticipant

public interface TwoPhaseParticipant

This is the interface that all two-phase commit aware participants must define.

Version:
$Id: TwoPhaseParticipant.java,v 1.1 2004/06/22 10:07:57 nmcl Exp $

Method Summary
 void commit()
          Commit the participant.
 void commitOnePhase()
          Commit the participant in a single phase.
 void forget()
          If a participant that said it had successfully prepared subsequently cannot adhere to that decision, or autonomously decides to commit or roll back, and the ultimate decision of the coordinator contradicts this choice, then a non-atomic outcome may result (a heuristic outcome).
 int prepare()
          Prepare the participant, i.e., execute the first phase of the two-phase commit protocol.
 void rollback()
          Rollback the participant.
 int status()
           
 

Method Detail

prepare

public int prepare()
            throws WrongStateException,
                   HeuristicHazardException,
                   HeuristicMixedException,
                   SystemException
Prepare the participant, i.e., execute the first phase of the two-phase commit protocol.

Returns:
the vote.
Throws:
WrongStateException - Thrown if the state of the participant is such that it cannot prepare.
HeuristicHazardException - Thrown if upon preparing, the participant finds that some of its enlisted participants have return statuses which mean it cannot determine what the result of issuing prepare to them has been.
HeuristicMixedException - Thrown if upon preparing, the participant finds that some of its enlisted participants have return statuses which mean some of them cancelled and some of them confirmed.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurred.
See Also:
Vote

commit

public void commit()
            throws WrongStateException,
                   HeuristicHazardException,
                   HeuristicMixedException,
                   HeuristicRollbackException,
                   SystemException
Commit the participant. Prepare must have been successfully executed.

Throws:
WrongStateException - Thrown if the state of the participant is such that it cannot commit.
HeuristicHazardException - Thrown if upon preparing, the participant finds that some of its enlisted participants have return statuses which mean it cannot determine what the result of issuing commit to them has been.
HeuristicMixedException - Thrown if upon preparing, the participant finds that some of its enlisted participants have return statuses which mean some of them rolled back and some of them committed.
HeuristicRollbackException - Thrown if the participant rolls back rather than commits.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurred.

rollback

public void rollback()
              throws WrongStateException,
                     HeuristicHazardException,
                     HeuristicMixedException,
                     HeuristicCommitException,
                     SystemException
Rollback the participant. Prepare need not have been received previously.

Throws:
WrongStateException - Thrown if the state of the participant is such that it cannot roll back.
HeuristicHazardException - Thrown if upon preparing, the participant finds that some of its enlisted participants have return statuses which mean it cannot determine what the result of issuing rollback to them has been.
HeuristicMixedException - Thrown if upon preparing, the participant finds that some of its enlisted participants have return statuses which mean some of them rolled back and some of them committed.
HeuristicCommitException - Thrown if the participant commits rather than rolls back.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurred.

commitOnePhase

public void commitOnePhase()
                    throws WrongStateException,
                           HeuristicHazardException,
                           HeuristicMixedException,
                           HeuristicRollbackException,
                           SystemException
Commit the participant in a single phase. If there is only a single participant enrolled with the transaction then there is no requirement on the coordinator to issue a prepare phase, since concensus is possible automatically.

Throws:
WrongStateException - Thrown if the state of the participant is such that it cannot commit.
HeuristicHazardException - Thrown if the participant acts as a subordinate coordinator and finds that some of its enlisted participants have return statuses which mean it cannot determine what the result of issuing commit to them has been.
HeuristicMixedException - Thrown if the participant acts as a subordinate coordinator and finds that some of its enlisted participants have return statuses which mean some of them rolled back and some of them committed.
HeuristicRollbackException - Thrown if the participant rolls back rather than commit.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurred.

forget

public void forget()
            throws WrongStateException,
                   SystemException
If a participant that said it had successfully prepared subsequently cannot adhere to that decision, or autonomously decides to commit or roll back, and the ultimate decision of the coordinator contradicts this choice, then a non-atomic outcome may result (a heuristic outcome). In this case, the participant must remember sufficient information about the transaction, the work performed and the heuristic in order that resolution may occur (typically off-line) even in the event of failures, i.e., this must be recorded durably. Once the heuristic has been resolved, the coordinator will issue a forget to inform the participant that it can remove this information.

Throws:
WrongStateException - Thrown if the participant is in an invalid state.
SystemException - Thrown in the event of a general fault.

status

public int status()
           throws SystemException
Returns:
the current status of the specified participant.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown in the event of a general error.
See Also:
Status
